bug.summary: Installation using requirements.txt bugs out with ModuleNotFoundError.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
pip install -U -r requirements.txt bugs out with ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'numpy' error. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Clone the repository and run pip install -U -r requirements.txt. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
It's supposed to install successfully but didn't. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Mac OS Catalina 10.15.6 <denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
To solve this:
Comment out the cocoapi line in requirements.txt. pip install -U -r requirements.txt pip install git+https://github.com/cocodataset/cocoapi.git#subdirectory=PythonAPI
I don't know a way to set the installation order in requirements.txt. I've seen some methods online where you can do this through setup.py. Filing this issue here and hoping someone with more expertise can fix this, or add a comment to the README.
